page.title: 01Aston and Cote
page.content: Agriculture predominates, arable & grassland. Arable fields are large with low cut hedges. The enormous elm trees which dominated hedgerows have disappeared with Dutch Elm disease. The area (Parish) lost the largest number of elms in Oxfordshire; replanting of other species has yet to make any impact on the flat landscape. Farmland is drained into the River Thames by ditches & Great Brook, man- made but lush in vegetation & appearing natural. The population, approx. 1400, live in either Aston, a village, Cote, a hamlet or one of 11 farms. Houses are a mixture of old & modern. There are no large houses which allows Aston to maintain a working/middle class appearance.
